main event: A USAF Colonel observed a large, round, metallic object floating at an estimated altitude of 10,000 feet above sea level in French Morocco on May 27, 1952.
interesting points: The object was under observation for a period of 20 to 30 minutes.
The witness, Colonel Tootlian, had over 900 hours of flying time over water and in the Pacific theater and had seen many phenomena.
The object did not move during the time of observation, as confirmed by the witness using reference to three other objects (sea markers).
The witness was unable to locate the object later on the same day and the following morning, despite similar weather conditions.
The report includes a hand-drawn map or diagram depicting the unidentified floating object and various geographic features.
